RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 7, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claimin g Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INAWIC vied for the lead and angled into the three path, settled into a stalking position, launched a bid at the three eights pole, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, led by the quarter pole, was pressured by an outside competitor, managed to keep distance between herself and the closing competitor, gradually pulled away fort the win. SWEET VIDALIA was off slow, trailed the field for the first call, improved position down the back side, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, shifted out into the five path, circled through the turn, challenged for the lead at the quarter pole, could never draw beside the eventual winner and was second best today. PEACEFUL VISION raced from mid pack in between horses in the three path, improved position, split horsed at the five sixteenth pole, drew near the leaders, had no rally in the stretch. SEE SASSY RUN was off a bit slow, raced off of the pace on the rail, saved ground early, launched a bid at the half mile pole, shifted out into the 6 path at the five sixteenth pole, was six wide in the stretch and closed mildly. SARA'S SAPPHIRE vied for the lead, took control and raced on the rail, set the pace, then retreated after the five sixteenth pole. MO BELLA stalked the early front runner, raced in the two path between foes, then tired. THE MISSING PIECE stalked form the outside in the five path, launched a bid at the half mile pole, advanced around the turn then faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: See Sassy Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, rail, saved ground, angled out 6 wide, upper

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Vidalia
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, bid 3/8, circled 5w, challenged, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Peaceful Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, between, split 5-16th, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: The Missing Piece
ENTRY.OWNER: Harden Patricia M and Hargrave Randall

ENTRY.NAME: Inawic
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 3/8, challenged 5-16th, led 1/4, pulled away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRANKY SHEILA stalked the front runner from the three path, launched a bid at the three eights pole, cleared the leader at the five sixteenth pole, was in full control at the quarter pole, drew off with no contest for the win. THE X FACTOR was off in the middle of the field, launched a bid at the three eights pole, raced in the four path, was i full stride by the quarter pole, was under heavy encouragement in the stretch, was closing in on the eventual winner with each stride, was about to take the lead and ran out of room, earning a game second place finish. MALLORI'S MAGIC was off a step slow, trailed the field early, made one run, building momentum with every stride, shifted into the four path when she launched a bid at the three eights pole, continued to gain ground, closed down the stretch hitting her best stride but could not get to the lead in time today. ABBEY CAKES took back early on, settled into the middle of the pack, raced in between foes, showed little late. IZEADISTORTEDLADY vied for the lead, set the pace while racing n the rail, showed the way then started a steady retreat at the five sixteenth pole. CONTEMPO GRAY raced from mid pack, saved ground and raced on the rail, improved position a bit then had no late kick. SENSING GOLD raced five wide, on the outside of the second tier of horses, moved up but could never really get involved. BABY YOUR PERFECT trailed, inside, no impact. QUARANTINED stalked the pace while racing on the rail then tired.

ENTRY.NAME: The X Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, bid 3/8, 4w, full stride 1/4, closed, encouraged, misse

ENTRY.NAME: Abbey Cakes
ENTRY.COMMENT: took back, rated, then showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Contempo Gray
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, saved ground, raced even

ENTRY.NAME: Mallori's Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, one run, cued 3/8, shifted 4w, momentum, close

ENTRY.NAME: Cranky Sheila
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 3/8, cleared 5-16th, led 1/4, no contest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRAFFIC CONTROL was forwardly placed along the outside of the pace setters, rated, raced four wide, was allowed to inch forward and take the lead in the turn, willingly took command, was given the cue at the quarter pole and drew off easily for an un contested win. PEPPERONIKID raced five wide and improved position from mid pack, gained ground through the turn, had cleared the second front runner by the quarter pole, but was no match for the winner but still ran a game second. CLASSIC RUNNER raced in the six and seven path, was off the pace and allowed to settle, launched a bid at the half mile pole, found his stride, was seven wide as he circled the field through the turn, was encouraged down the lane and responded well out finishing the rest. MESABI vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the pace early, could not sustain the bid and gave way. MIDNIGHT HUNTER stalked the front runner from the three path, then faded early. RED RAIDER XPRESS trailed the field early on, raced wide through the turn and made a mild bid late. MORO'S BULL CREEK raced from of the pace in the three path but to no avail. SAMSPLAYERSLOUNGE raced from mid pack along the rail and ran an even race. DIRECTIONAL was off mid pack, raced three wide behind horses, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, then faded in the stretch. JUST HANGIN RIDGE had an awkward start, still vied for the lead, raced on the rail then faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Just Hangin Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, vied, rail, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Red Raider Xpress
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, raced wide, mild bid late

ENTRY.NAME: Pepperonikid
ENTRY.OWNER: Prather, John H. and Linda K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, mid pack, gained ground turn, no match for winner

ENTRY.NAME: Mesabi
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail could not sustain the bid

ENTRY.NAME: Traffic Control
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, rated 4w, inched out, led, never challenged

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6-7w, off pace, one run, bid 1/2, 7 wide, upper, closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 7 1/2F Turf CR: 67. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANCIN N THEPULPIT stalked the front runner from the three path, was took back and asked to rate behind horses, willingly waited through the turn, was given the cue deep in the furlong ground and easily jumped up and took over putting away the rest and taking the win. LOVELY JOYCE was off of the pace in the early goings, raced six wide and improved position, passed through the middle of the field while still gaining ground, came to the quarter pole, was asked to close and did so handily getting up for second. ZEEROCK trailed the field by many early on was allowed to settle, coasted along the rail until the half mild pole, found his stride and started gaining, was in touch with the field by the three eighths pole, shifted out to circled the field on the outside, not taking any chances on braking momentum, closed down the stretch. SHE'S JERSEY TUFF stalked the pace from the five path, maintained the position into the middle of the stretch and put in a mild bid late. RECLAIMED vied for the lead, raced in the two path, led the others while setting the pace, was challenged and battled in the stretch but did not have enough today. LAYLA'S SONG raced off of the pace early, improved position, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, raced in the four path, cleared the rest and took the lead at the eighth pole, was racing in front for a few stride then was collared by another fast closing contender and faded in the last five strides. BELL PEPPER raced in mid pack, traveled in the four path, was in between foes, raced through the turn in between and behind horses shifted into the rail in the upper stretch and closed well, got behind a wall of horses in the last sixteenth of a mile and lost momentum looing for room, finished flat. COUSIN VICKIE raced in mid pack in the five path, advanced along the outside, the faltered. BEULAH K flashed early speed. HALF SCOUT vied for the lead, was asked to rate off of the pace and stalked closely behind, raced in the four path and was in contention then stopped at the quarter pole. PETULA was off in the middle of the field, raced on the fence and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Zeerock
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, trailed, settled, one run, circled turn, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin N Thepulpit
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, rated behind, maintained position, between, bid1/16,

ENTRY.NAME: Layla's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Kenneth W and Woodson Clinton J
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, improved, bid 3/8, 4w, led 1/8, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Lovely Joyce
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 6w, improved, mid pack, steady gain, closed well, 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Bell Pepper
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, between, shifted into the rail, lost momentum, flat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 26000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7, 2023 Allowe d 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ATTA PARTY vied for the lead, raced on the rail, had company beside him, led the race in a set, a third party joined on the outside, for a brief moment ATTA PARTY took a breather letting his rivals show their heads in front, the rival in the middle gave way, leaving two still battling for the lead, ATTA PARTY took command at the quarter pole and made it clear who the decisive leader was and drew off in the stretch for the win. JANETS JAY JAY raced from off of the pace, improved with each stride, was second best today. GOOD SCOUT stalked the front runners in the three path, moved up through the turn, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, was repelled by the quarter pole and tired in the stretch. SILVER WINGS trailed early, mild gain late. HE'S A BOMB flashed brief speed, raced in between rivals, faded. RELENTLESS DANCER off of the pace early and raced an even race. G'WILDCAT raced mid pack in the four path, maintained that position until the stretch where he had no rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Atta Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, led in a set, took command

ENTRY.NAME: Janets Jay Jay
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, steady gain, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Relentless Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, raced angled out, even race

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 7 1/2F Turf CR: 94. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 7, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 7, 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PEPPER JACK vied for the lead, led while saving ground racing on the rail, was asked at the quarter pole and willingly drew off down the stretch for an easy win. SEIZE THE TREASURE stalked the eventual winner from the two path, raced on the outside of another rival who was stalking from the rail, could not get close t the winner but battled down the lane with the same rival who stalked the winner from the rail, traded blows to the very end where SEIZE THE TREASURE put his neck in front seizing second place. FREEDOM FACTOR stalked, rail, battled, missed. WHEN'S TEE TIME was off mid pack, raced three wide outside of the third tier of competitors, maintained that position racing an even race. EXETER was off in the middle of the pack, raced in the two path as he stalked the leader from the third tier of horses. shifted down to the rail in the upper stretch but had no finish. ROCKDALE raced on the outside in the four path of the fourth tier of horses, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field through the turn, and then stopped. FREIGHTRAINFREEMAN off pace, rail, one run to no avail. YES BAB trailed through out. TEXAS TITAN was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Freightrainfreeman
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, one run to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Rockdale
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, bid 3/8, circled turn, quit

ENTRY.NAME: Exeter
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack 2w, inside 3rd tier, saved ground, rail upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Seize the Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, battled, out finished the rest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GREEK HEIRESS was off in the middle of the filed, raced on the rail saving ground through out, cut the corner and closed on the fence in the stretch drive getting up for third place money. JENNY'S PENNY stalked the front runner on the rail, maintained position through out, while being behind and inside of rivals, was kept on point and ridden down the rail, shifted out into the four path after the eighth pole, had a refreshing burst and got up for the win. MY OCHO stalked the pace from the three path, battled near the quarter pole from in between rivals, then had no kick. GOLD STRATEGY raced from off of the pace in the three path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field through the turn and tired. VOODOO MISTRESS was off mid pack and three wide and raced even. OUR PASTOR vied for the lead, led from the rail, led into the furlong ground, battled and just missed. MUSIC MISTRESS was never involved. JUST PUSH SEND flashed early speed. COUSIN KRISTI showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Greek Heiress
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, saved ground, closed, best of the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Jenny's Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, maintained position, shifted out deep stretch, up

ENTRY.NAME: Voodoo Mistress
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3 wide, raced angled out, even race

ENTRY.NAME: Just Push Send
ENTRY.OWNER: Robison J Kirk and Robison Judy
